main event: A witness observed a smoke trail that appeared to be falling and moving NNE, resembling the first phase of a 1/4 moon, for 20 minutes before it disappeared with the setting sun.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on January 16, 1956, at 18:55 Z,The object was observed moving from SSW to NNE,The observer described the colors of the object as it fell,The object seemingly disappeared as the sun set,Investigators concluded it was possibly a balloon.
witness description: The observer was a civilian source with a reputation for being mature and level-headed.
